name: Integrated Footwork Shadowboxing
purpose: Move through striking combinations with constant angle changes and stance resets. Focuses on smooth weight shifts, avoiding crossed feet, and reactive repositioning for fight-specific balance.
equipment_note: Ensure adequate space for lateral movement.

name: Single-Leg Cross-Body Punch
purpose: Balance on one leg while throwing slow, controlled crosses. Emphasizes knee stability (avoid hyperextension) and trunk-punch alignment for precision under instability.
equipment_note: Dumbbell (optional) for added resistance; keep weight light to avoid compromising balance.

name: Kick-and-Stick
purpose: Throw a roundhouse or front kick and freeze the leg fully extended for 2–3 seconds. Engages glutes for hip stabilization and trains control in kicking mechanics.
equipment_note: Use a wall for support if needed during initial progression.

name: Banded Triplanar Tap
purpose: Single-leg stance with band around knees; tap opposite foot forward/side/back without losing base. Prevents knee valgus and trains reactive stability for takedown defense.
equipment_note: Use light-moderate band tension anchored below knees.

name: Plank with Punch
purpose: From a high plank, shift weight and punch alternately while keeping hips level. Builds core-limb timing and simulates striking under fatigue.
equipment_note: Optional: Place hands on sliders to increase difficulty.

name: Rotational Med Ball Shotput
purpose: Lateral throw from a loaded stance, initiating power from the back foot. Reinforces hip-shoulder sequencing for hooks/clinch strikes.
equipment_note: Throw against a wall or to a partner for rebounding.

name: Depth Drop to Stabilize
purpose: Step off box and stick landing softly, absorbing impact through hips/knees. Trains fight-ready stabilization after level changes.
equipment_note: Start low; progress height only with mastery.

name: Sprawl to Quick Strikes
purpose: Drop into a sprawl, then explosively pop up into a combo. Sharpens defensive-offensive transitions under fatigue.
equipment_note: Gloves optional to simulate fight conditions.

name: Overhand Rush with Head Slip
purpose: Charge forward behind a high guard while throwing overhand rights, incorporating reactive head slips. Trains closing distance aggressively while maintaining defensive responsibility.
equipment_note: Partner throws light jabs to cue slips during entry.

name: Blindfolded Heavy Bag Chaos
purpose: Strike a heavy bag blindfolded while a partner randomly pushes/shakes it. Forces reliance on proprioceptive feedback to adjust punches and footwork mid-combo, simulating crowded brawling exchanges.
equipment_note: Use wraps to protect hands; partner cues angle changes.

name: Slip Rope with Counter Hooks
purpose: Weave under a bungee rope while throwing hooks to body/head after each slip. Trains head movement-to-power shot transitions under spatial constraints, critical for infighting.
equipment_note: Anchor rope to create zigzag path for lateral slips.

name: Medicine Ball Clinch Knees
purpose: From double-collar tie, drive knees upward while partner resists with med ball. Develops explosive hip extension and balance recovery after each knee, mimicking dirty boxing energy drains.
equipment_note: Partner holds ball against abdomen to resist knee drives.

name: Reactive Sprawl-to-Overhand
purpose: React to partner’s takedown feints by sprawling, then immediately exploding into an overhand right. Sharpens proprioceptive reactions to level changes and scrambles.
equipment_note: Partner mimics takedown attempts with verbal/striking cues.

name: Unstable Surface Hook Combinations
purpose: Throw 3–5 hook combos while balancing on unstable surface. Forces core engagement and compensational adjustments to maintain power generation—key for off-balance brawling.
equipment_note: Stand on Bosu dome-side down for advanced instability.

name: Tire Flip to Swarming Combo
purpose: Flip tire, then immediately swarm forward with punches (e.g., 1-2-3-2 combo). Links lower-body power to rapid upper-body coordination under fatigue, replicating fight-ending flurries.
equipment_note: Focus on explosive hip drive during flip.

name: Chaos Angle Change Pivot
purpose: Pivot off front foot at 45/90-degree angles while throwing hooks, reacting to partner's verbal cues. Trains rapid directional changes mid-combo—critical for cutting off the cage or cornering opponents.
equipment_note: Partner randomly calls direction changes during drill.

name: Blind Clinch Entry to Underhooks
purpose: With vision blocked, use hand-fighting to secure underhooks against a resisting partner. Sharpens proprioceptive sensitivity to upper-body positioning in tight spaces.
equipment_note: Partner wears MMA gloves to simulate realistic grips.

name: Slip-Block-Counter Sandbag Drill
purpose: Slip imaginary jabs, block body hooks (partner taps sandbag to your ribs), then counter with overhands. Integrates defensive reactions with offensive responses under tactile stimuli.
equipment_note: Partner holds bag at shoulder height for body shots.

name: Tumbling to Swarm
purpose: Execute a forward roll, pop up immediately into a 3-punch combo. Mimics recovering from trips or failed takedowns while maintaining offensive pressure.
equipment_note: Practice forward/backward rolls without using hands.

name: Resistance Band Phone Booth Hooks
purpose: Throw hooks against band resistance while maintaining perfect form. Teaches controlled power generation in tight spaces—prevents wild swinging when fatigued.
equipment_note: Band tension should allow full rotation but force control.

name: Reactive Wall Drill
purpose: Partner calls random punch numbers (1-6) while you strike the wall pad without resetting stance. Develops combo fluidity and adaptability in pocket exchanges.
equipment_note: Stand 6-12" from wall to enforce compact mechanics.

name: Blindfolded Collar Tie Pummeling
purpose: With vision blocked, alternate between collar ties and underhooks based solely on tactile feedback. Develops instinctive grip recognition in chaotic clinch battles.
equipment_note: Partner wears gi or rashguard for realistic friction

name: Thai Plum Knee-to-Sweep Chain

name: Rotational Judo Throw Recovery

name: Sprawl to Front Headlock
